container-title: Città di Castello in 1485 the Jews had to wear the “segno del .O.” and a year later in Perugia they were compelled to wear “lo .O. giallo.” See Ariel Toaff, The Jews in Umbria: 1435–1484
title: There are many other examples in Umbria. In Amelia in 1468: “Signo coloris croci per modium unius.O.” or “lu signo de lu.O.” Norcia specifically referred in 1478 to the sign as the letter O, and, interestingly, Jews could wear it in yellow or green: “Signum in formam littere .O. coloris viridis gialli granulini
